author: jovanka_
content: I had this question few weeks ago, and another though crosses my mind:

author: jovanka_
content: Aggregated attestations should (in ideal world) not overlap in any singular attestations i.e. not a single attestation should be present in two aggregations. So I am asking, do validators tasked with aggregation for that slot communicate between each other if certain attestation is already part of some aggregate to prevent overlaps? If they do, then why do we still have occasional overlaps?

author: jgm
content:
They "communicate" by sending aggregated attestations.  There is a subset of validators for each committee that aggregate, and they each have imperfect information and different aggregation algorithms.

Separately, packing is much easier if history of pre-existing aggregates is not taken in to account.  An ideal aggregate is one in which all attesting validators are represented, so all aggregation algorithms work towards this in their own way.
